_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Facility Policy
 The owners, management, and employees of Harvest Land Co-op are committed to the safe handling of anhydrous ammonia and the prevention of any accidential release.  If an accident occurs, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department and other authorities to mitigate the release and minimize the impact of the release on humans and the environment.

2. Facility Information
This facility is a retail ag supply center that handles a wide variety of farm supplies including fertilizers and pesticides.  We distribute anhydrous ammonia regulated by USEPA to our retail farm customers.  We receive anhydrous ammonia into our facility by rail and truck and store in approved aboveground sorage tanks. The tank sizes include one 60,000 gallon; one 30,000 gallon;and one 26,000 gallon.  We distribute the ammonia in 75 1000 gallon and 8 1500 gallon nurse tanks.  The combined total of storage tanks and nurse tanks gives our facility a total of 906,000 pounds of storage capacity.

3. Accident Release Program
The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K61.1" published by The American National Standads Institute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safetyand Health Administration, 29CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia."  Additional information contained in our Safety and Environmental Manual and the Rules and Regulations of the Indiana State Chemist concerning Anhydrous Ammonia are also utilized.

4. Five Year Accident History
To our knowledge there have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years that resulted in any injuries, deaths or significant environmental damage.

5. Emergency Response Program
This facility has a written emergency response plan in accordance with OSHA Standards.  We have provided state and local authorties the emergency planning and Rigt To Know information required by Sara Title III. The em

ergency response plan is reviewed annually and updated as necessary when changes occur.

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Safety improvement is an on-going process.  Periodic inspections are preformed to assess the operating conditions of the anhydrous ammonia system.  Any new rules or regulations, or other operating procedures are introduced they are evaluated and our procedures are updated to reflect those changes.
